inclusion.criterion: suffering from unilateral (cT< 3cm) in situ or invasive breast cancer
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: who are fit for breast conserving surgeries
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: lumpectomy was done and surgical margins were clear

inclusion.criterion: who had no previous breast surgery
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: independent from axillary surgery (sentinel lymph node biopsy or axillary block dissection)
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Age above 65 years or poor general health condition, where the estimated life expectancies would be less than 2 years even without a tumor
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Malignant invasive tumor in the past history (except for non-melanoma skin tumors)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Prior breast surgery (e.g. aesthetic surgery, breast lift) and/or radiotherapy on the breast or in the axilla
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Severe non-surgical (e.g. radiotherapy) complication, which could influence the aesthetic and functional results
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient is a 42 year-old postmenopausal woman with breast cancer. She had lumpectomy and clear margins, but has a history of smoking and alcohol consumption.
